item.title: Angus Taylor becomes Liberal leader after defeating Sussan Ley 34–17
item.description: Sussan Ley, the first female leader of the Liberal Party, is set to quit politics after losing a leadership vote today.

item.title: Norway's former PM, Thorbjoern Jagland, accused of aggravated corruption over Epstein links
item.description: The files indicate that Thorbjoern Jagland and Jeffrey Epstein's assistants made detailed plans in 2014 for the politician to visit the American in Palm Beach, Florida.

item.title: Albany Woollen Mills' 101 years celebrated via shared love of blankets
item.description: Established in 1925, Western Australia's first and only woollen mill transformed raw wool into fabric and blankets, becoming a cornerstone of Albany's industry before closing in 2002.

item.title: Record-breaking heatwave leaves some flower farmers without Valentine's Day blooms
item.description: A record heatwave has destroyed a Mallee flower farm's Valentine's Day blooms, leaving its owner devastated.

item.title: Adolescence writer Jack Thorne on his new TV adaptation of castaway novel Lord of the Flies
item.description: After winning an Emmy for writing Adolescence, Jack Thorne's latest project, a TV adaptation of Lord of the Flies, also sits at the intersection of vulnerability, masculinity and violence.

item.title: Bangladesh Nationalist Party wins nation's first election since gen Z-led uprising toppled Sheikh Hasina
item.description: The Bangladesh Nationalist Party has won a landmark parliamentary election, according to local TV stations, securing a resounding mandate in a pivotal vote.

item.title: AFL Origin 2026: Are footy fans still keen on interstate football?
item.description: After a break of more than a quarter of a century, AFL State of Origin returns in Perth tomorrow with a battle between two proud football states, Western Australia and Victoria.

item.title: Bald Archy satirical art prize highlights political victories, a murder trial and protest movements
item.description: From the trial of Erin Patterson to the landslide election victory, 2025 is pilloried in this year's satirical art prize, the Bald Archy.

item.title: Flower industry peak body pushes for country of origin labelling amid Valentine's Day rush
item.description: Millions of red roses will fly off florists' shelves this weekend, but the flower industry says there is not much to tell customers where the flowers are from.

item.title: Sunshine Coast environmentalists outraged by Comiskey Group Coochin Creek site approval
item.description: The Queensland government has approved a massive music festival and event site despite environmentalists saying it's "disgraceful" to put tourism before sustainability.

item.title: Australia in danger of World Cup elimination after 'unbelievable' loss to Zimbabwe
item.description: Australia's hopes of advancing out of Group B are dealt an almighty blow as Zimbabwe claims one of the biggest upset wins in T20 World Cup history in Colombo.

item.title: How do you find modern dating? Share your highs and lows with us
item.description: Whether you've shed tears of joy, sadness or even laughter in the process, we want to hear it all — but keep it under 150 words.

item.title: Support for all-ages performances among changes proposed for NSW's live music scene
item.description: The state government introduces what it describes as a "world first" bill to support the live music scene.

item.title: Teenager hit by a car at Narre Warren in Melbourne's south-east
item.description: A 16-year-old has life-threatening injuries after he was hit on Pound Road about 4:30pm.

item.title: Sydney children's author Oliver Phommavanh jailed for sending sexually explicit messages to minors
item.description: Oliver Phommavanh is sentenced to six-and-a-half years in prison with a non-parole period of four years.

item.title: Friday Finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: US aircraft carrier redeployed from Caribbean to Middle East as Iran tensions rise
item.description: The United States will send the USS Gerald R. Ford aircraft carrier to the Middle East amid escalating tensions with Iran, according to US media outlets.

item.title: Coroner finds police tactic not the cause of Toowoomba Indigenous man's death in custody
item.description: A Queensland coroner finds the cause of Indigenous man Steven Nixon-McKellar's death during an arrest was "multi-factorial".

item.title: Josie Baff wins 2026 Winter Olympic gold, a testament to the power of self-belief
item.description: Self-belief is the most powerful tool at an athlete's disposal, and Josie Baff utilised it to its fullest extent with a magical run to gold in the 2026 Winter Olympics snowboard cross.

item.title: Michael Mohammed Ahmad confronts traumatic childhood abuse in his new novel, Bugger
item.description: Michael Mohammed Ahmad, author of The Lebs, marks turning 40 with the publication of his most confronting novel yet.

item.title: Japanese lagers thrive as Kirin and Asahi loom over Australia's beer market
item.description: As record numbers of Australians continue to visit Japan, Japanese brewers have come to dominate our domestic beer market.

item.title: Residents in conservative Farrer eye future without Sussan Ley
item.description: Just minutes after deposed Liberal leader Sussan Ley announced her resignation, constituents in her electorate of Farrer began murmuring about change.

item.title: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz eyes European nuclear shield in call for reset with US
item.description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz reveals Berlin has begun confidential talks with France about a European nuclear deterrent, saying the region has to become stronger in order to reset its relationship with the United States.

item.title: DNA genealogy is changing the way NSW Police investigate cold cases
item.description: Australians looking to learn more about their heritage through commercial ancestry websites could be helping police solve cold cases.

item.title: Melbourne Storm accused by Parramatta Eels of asking NRL to intervene in Zac Lomax contract saga
item.description: Melbourne has been accused of asking NRL chief executive Andrew Abdo to "apply a blowtorch" to Parramatta as part of a desperate bid to sign Zac Lomax to the Storm.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Untouched illegal tyre dump sparks continued calls for legislation and innovation around recycling
item.description: When anti-dumping activist Dave Dudley goes bush he often stumbles across dumped tyres. It's an environmental risk he says the government needs to address.

item.title: Man, 18, in custody over alleged carjacking attempt in Hobart CBD
item.description: An 18-year-old man who allegedly used a screwdriver in an attempt to carjack a car with a woman and her two children inside in the middle of Hobart was overpowered by onlookers, Tasmania Police say.

item.title: Ready-to-go breakfast sandwiches that will get you through the day - ABC News
item.description: Want a prepped breakfast with plenty of protein? These omelette sandwiches keep for three days in the fridge, ready to pop in a sandwich press in the morning.

item.description: Looking for easy, nutritious Ramadan recipes? These options will help you prepare for and break your fast well.

item.title: Heat of summers gone by still fresh in the memory of 98yo Clarence 'Clack' John
item.description: Clarence "Clack" John has been through 98 summers in Renmark, South Australia. But as the town sweltered through its hottest recorded day last month, he remembers hot weather before records began.

item.title: Police appeal for help after 'priceless' Egyptian artefacts stolen from Caboolture museum north of Brisbane
item.description: An ancient burial mask, cat figurine and jewellery are among the "priceless" Egyptian artefacts stolen from the Abbey Museum of Art and Archaeology yesterday.

item.title: Australia and EU set to ink landmark free trade agreement
item.description: Australia and the European Union are on the cusp of finally reaching a free trade agreement after years of sometimes fraught negotiations.

item.title: Roads, homes, cars damaged as Alice Springs starts flash flood clean-up
item.description: With Alice Springs homes, businesses and roads damaged by flash flooding this week, the government is facing pressure to improve local flood mitigation measures.

item.title: Valentino Guseli thought he saw an 'omen from the shred gods' during the 2026 Winter Olympics halfpipe final
item.description: As Valentino Guseli watched his teammate Scotty James "tearing" the halfpipe apart, he thought an "omen from the shred gods" would deliver him an elusive Olympic gold medal.

item.title: Wool price jumps ahead of industry-first Chinese New Year break
item.description: As wool growers enjoy their best prices since 2019, the market will now pause to respect China's request for a week off to celebrate Lunar New Year.

item.description: Police make a rare appeal in what they say is the mistaken identity kidnapping of 85-year-old Chris Baghsarian in Sydney.

item.title: Two women die in crash after police pursuit in Sydney's south-west as critical incident declared
item.description: NSW Police say they pursued a red sedan after it had been stolen from a petrol station in South Hurstville and its owner allegedly assaulted.

item.title: The US government has just entered another shutdown. Here's what it means this time
item.description: After Congress failed to pass laws necessary to fully fund the US government, one of its biggest departments has shut down.

item.title: Carlton star taken to hospital as Victoria holds off WA in AFL Origin
item.description: Victoria holds off a spirited WA side to win the first Aussie rules State of Origin clash for 27 years, though the game is marred by a serious injury to Carlton star Jacob Weitering.

item.title: 'Freedom of memory': Ukrainian skier makes statement after helmet DQ
item.description: Ukrainian skier Kateryna Kotsar writes "freedom of memory" on her gloves in an apparent reference to compatriot Vladyslav Heraskevych's disqualification for wearing images of slain athletes on his helmet.

item.description: Jakara Anthony achieves Winter Olympic redemption, claiming a stunning gold medal in the women's dual moguls.

item.title: Russia poisoned opposition leader Alexei Navalny, UK and allies say
item.description: Five European foreign ministers say analysis of samples from the former Russian opposition leader, who died two years ago, confirmed the presence of a toxin from poison frogs.

item.title: Hard Quiz: Think you know the answers? That confidence won't last long
item.description: I admire your courage for giving the quiz another go. Just kidding, I never feel that way.

item.title: What we know (and don't) about One Nation's rapid rise in the polls
item.description: Pauline Hanson's One Nation has seen the fastest polling rise in modern Australian politics. What is going on?

item.title: Director Sophie Hyde unpacks long-held family secrets in her latest film Jimpa
item.description: Sophie Hyde's films have won awards at Sundance and Berlin, but she has more riding on her latest release. She's turned the lens on the long-held secrets of her unconventional family.

item.title: Palestinians say Israel's new plans for the West Bank kill statehood hopes
item.description: As Israel's security cabinet agreed on a plan that would pave the way for future settlements in the occupied West Bank, Palestinians say the pressure from Israeli settlers is relentless.

item.title: Rise of Australia's public economy is comparable to the mining boom of the 2000s, analyst says
item.description: Long-term structural shifts have gravitational forces that are hard to escape, says a Westpac economist.

item.title: Winter Olympics legend Eugenio Monti, the Italian sledder who helped his rivals win gold
item.description: As Bree Walker aims to create Olympic history in the women's monobob, she will do so on a track named after a man who made history of his own through one of the Winter Games' most selfless acts.

item.title: Dry January hits southern Australia as east coast lows drop off the radar
item.description: Rainfall was below average for most of Australia's south-east, far-west and central regions in the first month of the year.

item.title: Police block road near Nancy Guthrie's home during investigation into her disappearance
item.description: Authorities investigating the disappearance of American morning show host Savannah Guthrie's mother seal off a road near Nancy Guthrie's Arizona home.

item.title: South Molle's damaged jetty restricts access to island, with abandoned resort's future unclear
item.description: South Molle Island's former resort has been abandoned since it was damaged by a cyclone in 2017. Now, public access to the island is restricted after Cyclone Koji wreaked havoc on its jetty.

item.title: Woodstock Farm program helping steer troubled Queensland youth away from life of crime
item.description: The rural-based social program in the shadow of Mt Tamborine has had remarkable success in rebuilding the lives of youth who have fallen through the cracks.

item.title: Easy ways to help protect your hair from chlorine and saltwater damage
item.description: Regular beach days or laps at the local pool can leave our hair looking and feeling quite different.

item.title: Marco Rubio's speech to European allies takes softer tone but sticks to Trump's firm stance
item.description: America's top diplomat uses the Munich Security Conference to call for a renewed partnership between the United States and Europe, with Marco Rubio saying America and Europe "belong together".

item.description: NSW Police say they pursued a red sedan after it was stolen from a man who was filling up his car at a petrol station.

item.title: NT film industry on national stage as Kangaroo, Top End Bub and Journey Home win AACTA Awards
item.description: The NT's small but mighty presence is shining on the global stage 40 years after Crocodile Dundee rocketed its film industry into the stratosphere.

item.description: Protective gear is in short supply in Italy as tensions boil over in the curling and a Norwegian-born Brazilian makes history. Here are the quick hits from the Winter Olympics.

item.title: Italian migrants who brought 'fancy cheese' to Australia
item.description: When John Interlandi's father began making "fancy cheese" in Gippsland, few Australians had heard of parmesan. At 90 years old, Mr Interlandi is still perfecting it.

item.title: NSW premier announces extra public holiday in April for Anzac Day
item.description: New South Wales has the fewest public holidays in Australia, observing only 11.

item.description: Local brewers are experimenting with new flavours, while some farms invest in US-made machinery to modernise and streamline the harvest process.

item.title: As Jakara Anthony dealt with her singles moguls crash, her coach worked out how to pick her back up
item.description: As Jakara Anthony dealt with the disappointment of her singles moguls crash, her coach Peter McNiel was working out how to pick her back up.

item.title: Opposition draws battlelines on nuclear and capital gains tax changes
item.description: Deputy Liberal leader Jane Hume says Australia needs to be "open minded" on nuclear power if the country is to bring down emissions and make power cheaper.

item.title: Man dies after motorcycle hits kerb in Canberra's north
item.description: ACT Policing says the 24-year-old trail bike rider wasn't wearing a helmet when he hit a kerb near the Giralang shops.

item.title: Four boats destroyed in fire at Hillarys Boat Harbour, second blaze at marina in four months
item.description: Four boats are destroyed in a fire at Hillarys Boat Harbour, the second time a blaze has struck the marina in just over four months.

item.title: Obama deplores lack of shame after Trump shares monkey clip
item.description: Former US president Barack Obama has criticised a lack of shame and decorum in the country's political discourse, responding for the first time to a post on Donald Trump's social media account that depicted him and first lady Michelle as monkeys.

item.title: Statues of Amy Sherwin, Australia's first opera star, unveiled at Hobart's Hadley's Hotel in bid to cement legacy
item.description: An effort to bring new recognition to a Tasmanian opera star who became world famous, but who died poor, culminates in the unveiling of two statues of her in Hobart.

item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.title: Indigenous side overturns 14-0 deficit to down Maori in women's All Stars
item.description: The Indigenous team overturns a 14-0 deficit to score a rousing comeback win over the Maori in the Women's All Stars clash.

item.title: Frog toxins used to poison Alexei Navalny the latest in long history of Russian chemical attacks
item.description: Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny was poisoned by the Kremlin with a rare and lethal toxin found in the skin of poison dart frogs, five European countries have said. It's not the first time the country has been accused of poisoning its enemies.

item.title: Charlotte Mortlock quits Liberal Party following Sussan Ley leadership defeat
item.description: Women were less likely to vote for the Coalition at the 2025 election than ever before, according to the Australian Election Study.

item.title: Indigenous and Māori All Stars play out dramatic 16-all draw
item.description: It went down to the final seconds, but the Indigenous and Maori NRL All Stars could not be separated with both sides left to rue missed chances after a 16-all draw.

item.title: Chinese star takes swipe at organisers for not accommodating her schedule
item.description: Chinese skiing superstar Eileen Gu says she is "disappointed" and "saddened" that Winter Olympics organisers scheduled halfpipe training at the same time as her big air final at the MIlano Cortina Games.

item.title: Matt Graham wins dual moguls bronze at the 2026 Winter Olympics
item.description: Matt Graham's medal is the third Australia’s moguls squad has delivered at the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics.

item.title: City of Melbourne quiet on plan for Southbank's 'ugly' red stairs, long after design competition announced
item.description: A Melbourne council unveiled a lucrative competition to replace Southbank's much-derided red stairs. But a year after it was due to start, the plan appears to have gone nowhere.

item.title: Today in History, February 16: Steven Bradbury's Winter Olympic Games golden miracle at Salt Lake City in 2002
item.description: In 2002, Australia broke its Winter Olympics gold medal duck in the most extraordinary of ways, as Steven Bradbury put a decade of injury and bad luck behind him to claim the most thrilling of gold medals.

item.title: What is FAFO parenting and is it good for kids?
item.description: Is FAFO the 1980s parenting style today's generation of kids need, rebellion against gentle child-rearing, or exhausted parents just throwing their hands in the air?

item.title: Liberal Party divided over policy direction as Angus Taylor plots right-wing political shift
item.description: Angus Taylor says he will unite the Liberal Party, but a deeper rift is forming between those who want to overhaul the party's direction and those who believe doing so would mean political death.

item.title: ACCC takes Coles to court over 'illusory' discounts in 'case of the century'
item.description: The "case of the century" is set to play out in the federal court this month, with the ACCC taking on supermarket giant Coles for what it claims are "illusory" discounts.

item.title: AI is evolving fast and may bring the fourth industrial revolution with it
item.description: A fake news story about me, a series of AI breakthroughs and a resignation in the tech world show that 2026 could be pivotal for AI.

item.title: As high-speed rail plans gather pace, Britain's HS2 offers hard lessons
item.description: While the federal government considers an ambitious plan, a similar project in the UK has seen its fair share of controversies.

item.title: Shark population may have fallen prey to algal bloom, SA ecologists fear
item.description: South Australia's algal bloom could be responsible for pushing a local population of sharks to the brink of collapse, some researchers say.

item.title: Cape Barren Island uses greenhouse and traditional foods to keep fridges full
item.description: A tiny island off the coast of Tasmania is embracing old and new techniques to keep food on the table.

item.description: Supermarket giant Coles and the consumer watchdog are in the Federal Court. The ASX closes marginally higher after a busy session of results.

item.description: Speculation is mounting over who will be promoted to the shadow cabinet after Angus Taylor's elevation to the leadership.

item.title: Dams and rivers run dry, forcing Victorian farmers to make tough decisions about their livestock
item.description: Victorian farmers are forced to cart water or destock as dams and rivers run dry.

item.description: A Northern Territory politician has been accused of bullying by two female staffers while leading a parliamentary committee, the ABC can reveal.

item.title: Rescuers race to find entangled whale last seen near Wilsons Promontory
item.description: Authorities are looking for a juvenile humpback whale last seen entangled in rope off the coast near Wilsons Promontory.

item.title: Future of fishing prosecutions unclear after multi-million-dollar abalone trafficking case collapses
item.description: Subpoenaed documents obtained by the ABC reveal NSW Police continued prosecuting seven men for illegally trafficking abalone despite advice that their case was likely to fail.

item.title: Why Australian Adam Lambert's medal-losing crash in the final made him feel better about his Winter Olympics
item.description: Adam Lambert's crash in the mixed snowboard cross cost Australia a chance at a medal at the 2026 Winter Olympic Games, but it still makes him feel better about his campaign.

item.title: Chalmers mocks Taylor's proposal for bipartisan budget savings taskforce
item.description: Angus Taylor wrote to the prime minister pitching the plan just days after being elected leader of the Liberal Party.

item.title: Meet GayC/DC, the world's only all-gay AC/DC tribute band
item.description: They worship the riffs, rewrite the lyrics and win over the toughest crowds. GayC/DC is a tribute band like no other.

item.title: Israeli air strikes target Gaza Palestinians just days before Board of Peace meeting
item.description: US President Donald Trump says the first meeting of his newly created Board of Peace will take place on Thursday, with over $7 billion to be pledged for reconstruction and humanitarian efforts in Gaza.

item.title: Traditional owners 'won't accept' handback of rehabilitated Argyle diamond mine site
item.description: East Kimberley traditional owners are concerned Rio Tinto's closure plan will leave them with "a giant hole in the ground forever".

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Matt Graham on dual moguls 'dad podium' as weather forces reschedule — quick hits from day nine
item.description: A trio of dads fill the dual moguls podium as an "unfavourable" forecast leaves things up in the air. Here are the quick hits from day nine of the Milano Cortina Games.

item.title: Vermilion's Wandoo gas exports halted after December oil spill
item.description: Exports from an oil field off WA's Pilbara are at a standstill after an oil spill in December. The regulator says it has identified "systemic failures" at the Canadian-owned Wandoo facility.

item.title: Bondi Beach terror attack gunman Naveed Akram appears in court for the first time
item.description: Bondi Beach gunman Naveed Akram, who is charged with 15 counts of murder, has appeared via video link for the first time in a Sydney court as a senior magistrate extended existing suppression orders in the case.

item.title: Police make 'very strange' appeal for return of kidnapped 85yo Sydney man
item.description: Detectives believe Chris Baghsarian was mistakenly snatched from his bedroom just after 5am on Friday by intruders who forced their way into his North Ryde property.

item.title: Antarctic type B killer whales seen for first time near WA's Bremer Bay
item.description: Sightings of Antarctic orcas in Australian waters are very rare. A tour group in WA saw what appeared to be a pod of Antarctic type B killer whales muscle in and steal the meal of a local group of orcas.

item.title: Brett Pointing to replace Steve Gollschewski as Queensland police commissioner on 12-month interim basis
item.description: Brett Pointing has been named as the interim Queensland police commissioner after Steve Gollschewski announced his retirement.

item.title: New tobacco laws proposed by WA government to target stores selling illegal cigarettes, vapes
item.description: Western Australia could soon have some of the nation's toughest illegal tobacco penalties, including fines of up to $21 million and hefty prison terms for possessing commercial quantities of illicit products.

item.title: Senior Liberals deny involvement in draft policy to ban migrants from Gaza
item.description: A leaked copy of the Liberal Party's migration policy prepared before Sussan Ley was ousted included plans to "elevate" the current non-binding Australian values statement.

item.title: ACCC accuses Coles of 'planned' campaign to mislead customers
item.description: Supermarket giant Coles is accused of a "planned" campaign to mislead customers over discounts on the first day of a bombshell Federal Court case.

item.title: Canberra man accused of stalking couple and leaving them notes denied bail in ACT Magistrates Court
item.description: The man allegedly went to the married couple's home four times in two months, seeking access while claiming to be an arborist on one occasion, and attempting to remove the home's doorbell camera on another.

item.title: From the weird to the wonderful, here are nine times politicians have become a meme
item.description: From the downright weird to the speech that soared, Australia's politicians are under constant scrutiny. Here are some startling moments when the politician became the meme.

item.title: Man accused of Caboolture museum heist allegedly believed it was his 'duty' to return artefacts to 'rightful place', court told
item.description: Miguel Simon Mungarrieta Monsalve has been charged with a range of offences after he allegedly broke into a Caboolture museum on Friday morning.

item.title: Perth Diving Academy Hillarys fined almost $20,000 after leaving two divers in ocean
item.description: Perth Diving Academy Hillarys is fined almost $20,000 after an Australian Maritime Safety Authority probe found it took the crew on board 10 minutes to realise two divers had been left behind.

item.title: Heat, storms lead to extreme fire forecast across dry Victoria
item.description: Almost half the state is expected to face extreme fire conditions on Tuesday due to a mix of heat, dry fuels and gusty afternoon storms.

item.description: Find out what is on during Day 10 at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.title: Raymond Reddington murder trial hears evidence of marriage breakdown between him and Sharon Fulton
item.description: A Perth court hears a woman who was allegedly murdered by her husband 40 years ago initiated separation proceedings in 1985, the year before she went missing.

item.title: Canberra woman allegedly held captive for two days and raped was 'subdued with violence', court hears
item.description: A woman who fled naked into a Canberra street and told police she thought she was going to die had just escaped two days of alleged violent captivity, a jury has heard.

item.title: Stepson tells hearing terminally ill man 'wanted to be done' as wife committed to stand trial for his murder
item.description: Kylie Truswell-Mobbs has been committed to stand trial for the murder of her husband David Mobbs, who had motor neurone disease, after he was allegedly given a fatal dose of medication.

item.title: CLP announces Anjan Paudel as Nightcliff by-election candidate, Phil Scott runs as independent
item.description: More candidates for the Nightcliff by-election are announced, with Phil Scott running as an independent and the Country Liberal Party preselecting Anjan Paudel, who has stumbled while answering basic policy questions.

item.title: Aussie Walker finishes outside of medals at Milano Cortina Games
item.description: Australia's Bree Walker missed a spot on the podium but still managed a top-eight placing in the monobob at the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics.

item.title: Australian women and children with links to ISIS forced to head back to camp in Syria
item.description: A group of Australian families with links to Islamic State fighters are forced to turn around after leaving a camp in Syria to try and begin their journey home to Australia.

item.title: New Coalition leader Angus Taylor denies knowledge of Ley immigration policy
item.description: Opposition Leader Angus Taylor says he does not know anything about Sussan Ley's proposed immigration policy and that "more supply" is key to solving Australia's housing crisis.

item.title: Kremlin rejects European accusations it poisoned Alexei Navalny with dart frog toxin
item.description: The Kremlin has rejected accusations from five European countries that the Russian state had killed late Kremlin critic Alexei Navalny two years ago using toxin from poison dart frogs.

item.title: The night snow came to Livigno, turning this surreal valley into an even greater paradise
item.description: Livigno is an Italian outlier in more ways than one. Already known for its special tax status and fairytale quality, the town has had a phenomenal dumping of snow, causing a significant shuffling of events.

item.title: Ukrainian ex-minister Herman Halushchenko accused of stashing laundered millions offshore
item.description: Ukraine's anti-corruption police have accused its ex-energy minister of helping launder kickbacks and stashing millions offshore, a day after he was detained trying to leave the country.

item.title: Robert Duvall, star of The Godfather and Apocalypse Now, dies at 95
item.description: Oscar winner Robert Duvall, known for films such as The Godfather and Apocalypse Now, has died at the age of 95.

item.title: How to decide what type of car insurance is best for you
item.description: Choosing the right car insurance option can feel daunting, but it's the kind of task that it pays to get right. So, how can you decide which type is most suitable for you?

item.title: Results show high levels of lead contamination in dust around Hobart, as EPA flags further tests
item.description: High levels of lead contamination have been found in dust samples taken from suburban locations close to Nyrstar's Hobart zinc smelter, documents obtained by the ABC show.

item.title: Tradies consider leaving careers over lack of onsite toilets
item.description: Tradies are walking out. Not over ability or aptitude but toilets — in a symbol of the sector's persistent barriers.

item.title: Anti-slavery commissioner calls for tougher laws amid forced labour concerns for Ansell and Kmart
item.description: Australia's anti-slavery commissioner calls for tough new laws forcing companies to take slavery in their supply chains seriously, as Ansell and Kmart face scrutiny.

item.title: Iran's state TV airs 'forced confessions' of 'scapegoats' whose families fear could face execution
item.description: Families of Baha'i youth arrested by Iran's security forces say they've been subject to "forced confessions" and fear they may face the death penalty.

item.title: Tasmanian Motor Accident Insurance Board suing Melissa Oates for $934k in damages over Jari Wise's death
item.description: A woman who hit and killed her partner with her car in 2020 is being pursued for almost $1 million in damages by the Tasmanian Motor Accident Insurance Board.

item.title: Mould, asbestos, collapsed ceilings plague some South Australian schools
item.description: Almost two years after a state government report revealed 35 per cent of all buildings within the Department for Education's portfolio were past their design life, many schools are still plagued with issues including mould, asbestos and rotting windows.

item.title: Ley backers demoted as Taylor unveils new front bench — as it happened
item.description: Angus Taylor has unveiled his new-look front bench, promoting key allies and relegating backers of deposed Liberal leader Sussan Ley.

item.title: What we know about the ISIS-linked families in Syria who want to return to Australia
item.description: Australia has made limited progress in clearing a passage for the Australian women and their children, citing safety issues in and around the camps, and security concerns back home.

item.title: 'Too complex': Coles lawyer says grocery prices tough to understand — as it happened
item.description: Coles has faced hearings at the Federal Court in Melbourne regarding accusations of misleading customers on discounts. The Australian share market was up, following Wall Street. Look back on the day's events and insights from our business reporters in the ABC News markets blog.

item.title: Juanella Donovan reflects on People's Choice win at National Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art Awards
item.description: Juanella Donovan has taken out the People's Choice category at the National Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Art Awards for the second time, emerging as the public favourite from more than 200 entries across the country.

item.title: Pod Save America and why Australians remain obssessed with US politics
item.description: Huge crowds have flocked to live shows for the popular and influential Pod Save America podcast, suggesting Australia's obsession with US politics isn't going away anytime soon.

item.title: Search for abducted Sydney man Chris Baghsarian continues, family living 'a nightmare'
item.description: The family of Sydney man Chris Baghsarian, who was abducted in a case of mistaken identity four days ago, are awaiting "some form of closure or resolution".

item.title: PM will not repatriate Australians with IS links in Syria
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Highly sensitive Australian court data accessed by foreign entity based in India
item.description: Highly sensitive Australian court files have been accessed offshore in breach of the privacy act and Commonwealth contractual obligations, an ABC investigation has revealed, raising concerns of a national security risk.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Eileen Gu medals despite blizzard, Ilia Malinin breaks his silence — day 10 quick hits
item.description: A Norwegian skier melts down in the Italian cold as the Canadian women's curling team hits back at cheating accusations. Here are the quick hits from day 10 of the Milano Cortina Winter Games.

item.title: Emu raids on Nannup's rubbish tip spark growing concerns for mob's health
item.description: Emus raiding Nannup's rubbish tip are ending up with rotisserie chicken bags and piping stuck around their necks.

item.title: Austrian man faces terror charges over Taylor Swift concert plot
item.description: Austrian prosecutors have filed terrorism-related charges against a 21-year-old man who they say planned to carry out an Islamist militant attack at one of Taylor Swift's 2024 concerts in Vienna.

item.title: Criminal defamation case against Australian writer Murray Hunter withdrawn from Thai court
item.description: The Malaysian Communications and Multimedia Commission has dropped a criminal defamation case against Australian writer Murray Hunter.

item.title: WA's illegal tobacco crackdown comes after less than $89,000 in fines issued last year
item.description: Amid moves to increase penalties for those involved in the illegal tobacco trade, Western Australian authorities are slammed for handing out just $88,100 in fines last year.

item.title: One man dead, two people critically injured in 'random' Sydney stabbing attack
item.description: Police were told on arrival at the scene in Merrylands that a man stabbed multiple people before leaving the area on foot.

item.title: Plains-wanderer recorded for first time on outback Queensland cattle station
item.description: A project with dozens of monitoring sites across the Queensland property confirms the presence of the critically endangered plains-wanderer by analysing bird calls.

item.title: Brandan Koschel's antisemitic speech at Sydney March for Australia rally 'abhorrent', says prosecutor
item.description: Brandan Koschel was arrested after he appeared on a stage for an open mic session during the anti-immigration March for Australia event in Sydney's Moore Park.

item.title: Former ACT commissioner Vanessa Turnbull-Roberts accuses public servant of sexual assault
item.description: Vanessa Turnbull-Roberts says she stepped down as the ACT's first Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander children and young people commissioner to prioritise her safety after being subjected to sexual harassment and sexual assault by a public servant.

item.title: Suspicious fire at Thornton business
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Bushfire threatens properties in central Victoria, with rising heat to be followed by gusty storms
item.description: The fire at Trawool, south of Seymour, broke out near the Goulburn Valley Highway in central Victoria on a day when half the state was facing extreme fire danger.

item.title: Four men again jailed for life for killing Albanian refugee Urim Gjabri in Adelaide
item.description: Four men who faced a retrial over the murder of Albanian refugee Urim Gjabri in Adelaide's north in 2018 are again jailed for life, with the judge saying their crime was motivated by "greed and [a] desire to rob him of the cannabis".

item.title: Western Australia's demersal fishing ban hits hard in coastal tourist town of Kalbarri
item.description: People in the coastal tourist town of Kalbarri say they are already suffering the effects of WA's demersal fishing ban, less than two months after it came into force.

item.title: Angus Taylor reveals shadow ministry, elevating Andrew Hastie and Jacinta Nampijinpa Price
item.description: The new Liberal leader announces his shadow ministry, elevating prominent right-faction supporters including West Australian MP Andrew Hastie.

item.title: ABC Radio Perth's move to switch to FM aims for better news delivery
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Liam Alexander Hall revealed as man charged over alleged terrorism act at Perth Invasion Day rally
item.description: The man accused of throwing a bomb at Invasion Day protesters in an alleged terrorism act attack in Perth can be named as Liam Alexander Hall.

item.title: Coles downplays meaning of 'Down Down' price tags and advertising in case against ACCC
item.description: Coles downplays what shoppers understood when they saw its "Down Down" price tags, saying "not much", on the second day of a bombshell federal court case.

item.title: Man accused of murdering Canberra grandmother Irma Palasics pleads guilty to burglary charge as trial begins
item.description: Lawyers for one of two men on trial for the 1999 murder of Canberra grandmother Irma Palasics tell the ACT Supreme Court he was just the lookout, and had nothing to do with her death.

item.title: Fire crews battle blaze south of Launceston
item.description: The Tasmania Fire Service has downgraded an emergency bushfire warning for an area south of Launceston, with helicopters and ground crews in attendance.

item.title: Balonne Shire Council faces $3.8m fine due to unauthorised fires at Dirranbandi Waste Facility
item.description: There have been several unauthorised fires lit at the waste facility of a rural Queensland council, with the Department of the Environment warning it could lead to a hefty fine.

item.title: Mobil Oil Australia to pay $16m fine for misleading claims about fuel sold in Queensland
item.description: The ACCC said Mobil advertised its Mobil Synergy fuel but did not actually supply the product at the time.

item.title: French Polynesia drug haul hits $2.4 billion in a month as third shipment intercepted
item.description: French authorities seized a 2.4-tonne drug shipment near French Polynesia during a joint operation with the United States.

item.title: Iran launches military drill as US deploys aircraft carrier on eve of nuclear talks
item.description: Representatives from the two nations are set to meet in Geneva on Tuesday, local time, as US President Donald Trump tries to curb Tehran's nuclear program.

item.title: Australian production company Matchbox Pictures to be closed by Universal International Studios
item.description: Matchbox Pictures, the local production house behind Dog Park, The Survivors and Secret City, will be closed by its international parent company, Universal International Studios.

item.title: Jury shown footage of alleged attack on Strathmerton postmaster John Burke
item.description: A jury in the trial of Troy Maskell, accused of the manslaughter death of 73-year-old John Burke, has watched CCTV footage of the alleged incident.

item.title: Police drop charges against WIM Resource employee accused of falsifying documents
item.description: Victoria Police has dropped all charges against WIM Resource employee Murray Wilson, who worked on the controversial Avonbank Mineral Sands Project.

item.title: Mother of former Manly player Keith Titmuss breaks silence on lawsuit against NRL club
item.description: The mother of Manly player Keith Titmuss, who died of exertional heat stroke following a 2020 Sea Eagles training session, breaks her silence on her family's multi-million-dollar lawsuit against the NRL club.

item.title: Man charged over alleged terrorism act at Perth Invasion Day rally named
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Sydney’s great fatberg hiding in the sewers
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: ABC to move Adelaide office to new Tapangka site in CBD, alongside arts organisations
item.description: The ABC has announced a new location for its Adelaide operations, moving to a new arts and media hub alongside other government arts organisation in the CBD.

item.title: Grammy-winning songwriter and hitmaker Billy Steinberg dies aged 75
item.description: Award-winning US songwriter Billy Steinberg, who wrote several top hit songs including Madonna's Like a Virgin, died on Monday aged 75, according to media reports.

item.title: Jail term increased for Roma man who stabbed police officer during call-out
item.description: A man who stabbed a police officer with a pair of scissors during a domestic violence call-out in regional Queensland has had his jail sentence increased.

item.title: Escalating violence from youth gangs in Melbourne
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: NSW man kept in custody for safety after allegedly 'squandering' $270k of drug-trade money
item.description: Peter John Howlett, who allegedly used a fishing trawler to import illicit drugs into Australia, is refused bail by Mackay magistrate concerned for his safety.

item.title: Australia knocked out of T20 World Cup with one game left to play
item.description: Australia can no longer catch up with Zimbabwe after it was awarded a point from a rained out match with Ireland.

item.title: Donald Trump to decide on sending weapons to Taiwan 'soon' despite warnings from China
item.description: Despite China's President Xi Jinping warning the US not to send weapons to Taiwan, Donald Trump says he will make a decision soon.

item.title: Travel quiz, February 18: Which Australian airport has the most runways?
item.description: The Scottish festival Hogmanay celebrates which event? And where is halo-halo from?

item.title: Tasmanian salmon industry subject to stricter mortality reporting rules
item.description: Biosecurity Tasmania has introduced stricter requirements for Tasmania's salmon companies reporting on farmed fish deaths — but whether the public finds out is another matter.

item.title: Private health insurance customers stung by exclusions after downgrading from gold policies
item.description: Australians are increasingly downgrading their health cover, with 360,000 people leaving gold policies since 2020. But some have been left out of pocket for surgeries they thought they were covered for.

item.title: Aerials delay is not unusual, as snow causes chaos at Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics
item.description: Delays are nothing new in skiing events, with weather and light a constant battle for event organisers. However, the Australian aerials team has an unusual method to handle the disruption.

item.title: Investor's bet on empty building and passionate self-starters transform Charleville CBD
item.description: A few years ago, Charleville's main street had lost its spark, with storefronts empty and windows shuttered. So, what does it take to bring a main street back to life?

item.title: Long-term solution to repeated Waterfall Way landslips on the horizon
item.description: The NSW government hopes to reopen a key east-west transport route by April, as a long-term solution to frequent landslips in the area is explored.

item.title: Police to return to Oak Park 'frequently' in search for Gus Lamont
item.description: SA's Police Commissioner says officers will be returning to Oak Park station frequently in the coming months as they continue their investigation into the disappearance of Gus Lamont.

item.title: Hindmarsh Island bridge dispute told through Ngarrindjeri women's art
item.description: In the 1990s, a group of Indigenous women were accused of fabricating claims of sacred sites to stop the construction of a bridge south of Adelaide. It was a decision that has impacted a community for decades.

item.title: Disenfranchised Farrer voters turn out in droves to consider One Nation
item.description: This southern New South Wales town of Gerogery is typically dead on a Monday night, but that all changed when One Nation came to town.

item.title: Living across the river from Nyrstar zinc smelter has Jan doing what she can to lower lead risk
item.description: Jan Twomey bought a house on Hobart's eastern shore just over a year ago, knowing full well it was across from a zinc smelter. But news of high levels of lead detected in dust samples has her concerned.

item.title: Police find bodies of man and woman in Rockhampton home
item.description: Police are investigating after finding two bodies during a welfare check in Rockhampton.

item.title: OCD is often misunderstood. Elena wants you to know what it feels like
item.description: Elena wants people with OCD to know they're not alone. But how well do Australians understand the condition?

item.title: Matildas expected to name Mary Fowler in Asian Cup squad, injured Charli Grant set to miss out
item.description: Mary Fowler is expected to be named in Australia's Women's Asian Cup squad on Thursday despite having played limited minutes in her return from an ACL injury.

item.title: Live: One Nation expecting a 'Melbourne Cup'-like race to decide Farrer candidate
item.description: One Nation leader Pauline Hanson says about 80 people have applied to be the party's candidate for Farrer in the upcoming by-election. Follow live.

item.title: Trawool bushfire threat eases but authorities say blaze not yet under control
item.description: Authorities say weather conditions have helped fire crews battling a blaze that threatened homes near Trawool, south of Seymour.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Jürgen Klopp makes Milano Cortina Games cameo, ice hockey fight ban labelled a 'joke' — quick hits from day 11
item.description: Football manager Jürgen Klopp makes an appearance at the Milano Cortina Games, while French ice hockey players are unhappy about the ban handed to a teammate for fighting. Here are the quick hits from day 11.

item.title: Riverland wine grape growers want to rezone land for housing to exit industry
item.description: The wine grape industry in South Australia's Riverland continues to face unprecedented levels of uncertainty, as growers look to exit the industry and turn their land into residential housing.

item.title: Live: NAB quarterly profit jumps to $2.1b, Australian dollar hits 19-month high against British pound
item.description: The Australian dollar has risen to its highest level in a year and a half against the British pound, while the ASX has started its day higher, and NAB reports a significant increase in its quarterly profit. Follow live.

item.title: Eungella residents want an alternative exit after Cyclone Koji cuts the range road again
item.description: The remote mountain community of Eungella was cut off for the second time in three years after Cyclone Koji brought debris down on the range road. After years of inaction, the community want more options when severe weather strikes again.

item.title: Sydney Writers' Festival announces Randel Abdel-Fatah for 2026 program
item.description: Sydney Writers' Festival has defended featuring Randa Abdel-Fattah on its 2026 program, saying it is "not in the business of cancelling or censoring writers".

item.title: T-bone collision in Lake Grace sparks calls for better solution at notorious intersection
item.description: Locals in the Great Southern town of Lake Grace fear someone will die at a notorious intersection where hundreds of drivers fail to comply with a stop sign.

item.title: Pauline Hanson issues partial apology for suggesting there are no 'good' Muslims
item.description: The One Nation leader qualified her earlier remarks, which had been met with condemnation, while reiterating calls for tougher vetting processes for Muslim migrants.

item.title: Broken Hill greyhound race track to close creating 'flood' of dogs needing homes
item.description: One hundred years of greyhound racing in far west NSW is about to come to an end.

item.title: One man dead and another in serious condition after Bruce Highway crash in Burpengary
item.description: One man has died and another is in a life-threatening condition after a truck crashed into a car while driving the wrong direction on the Bruce Highway on Tuesday night.

item.title: Rising land prices the main factor blocking new housing, report finds
item.description: A Housing Industry Association report says rising land prices are blocking the construction of new homes.
